page.title: 18Shepley First School.
page.content: Shepley First School is a very old building built in 1896.The main material used is stone,covered with very steeply sloping roofs.The school has approximately two hundred children aged four to ten .The catchment area extends as far as the edge of Birds Edge,Stocksmoor and Thunderbridge. Apart from the Headteacher there are seven full time members of staff,one part timer,one secretary/N.T.A.,one caretaker,two cleaners,three cooks ,three dinner supervisors and a crossing lady. The children have a huge playground to play in,plus a small field known locally as the "Hen Field".The school is situated in a very rural position and it is possible to go for extensive walks from the school without crossing any roads.Education in pleasant surroundings.
